org.lwjgl.system.xxhash

Class XXHash

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.system.xxhash.XXHash

  • public class XXHash
extends java.lang.Object
    Native bindings to xxhash.

    xxHash is an extremely fast Hash algorithm, running at RAM speed limits. It also successfully passes all tests from the SMHasher suite.

    • Method Detail

      • XXH32

        public static int XXH32(java.nio.ByteBuffer input,
        long length,
        int seed)
        Calculates the 32-bits hash of sequence length bytes stored at memory address input.

        This function successfully passes all SMHasher tests.

        Parameters:
        input - the bytes to hash. The memory between input & input+length must be valid (allocated and read-accessible).
        length - the number of bytes stored at memory address input
        seed - the seed that can be used to alter the result predictably

      • XXH32

        public static int XXH32(java.nio.ByteBuffer input,
        int seed)
        Alternative version of: 32

      • XXH64

        public static long XXH64(java.nio.ByteBuffer input,
         long length,
         long seed)
        64-bit version of 32. Faster on 64-bits systems. Slower on 32-bits systems.
        Parameters:
        input - the bytes to hash. The memory between input & input+length must be valid (allocated and read-accessible).
        length - the number of bytes stored at memory address input
        seed - the seed that can be used to alter the result predictably

      • XXH64

        public static long XXH64(java.nio.ByteBuffer input,
         long seed)
        Alternative version of: 64

      • XXH32_createState

        public static XXH32State XXH32_createState()
        Creates memory for XXH32State. The state must then be initialized using 32_reset before first use.

        LWJGL note: This function simply delegates to the system malloc() function.

      • XXH32_freeState

        public static int XXH32_freeState(XXH32State statePtr)
        Frees the specified XXH32State.

        LWJGL note: This function simply delegates to the system free() function.

        Parameters:
        statePtr - the state to free

      • XXH64_createState

      • XXH32_reset

        public static int XXH32_reset(XXH32State statePtr,
              int seed)
        Resets the specified XXH32State.
        Parameters:
        statePtr - the XXH32State to reset
        seed - the seed that can be used to alter the hashing result predictably

      • XXH32_update

        public static int XXH32_update(XXH32State statePtr,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer input,
               long length)
        Calculate the xxHash of an input provided in multiple smaller packets, as opposed to an input provided as a single block.

        The XXH state space must first be allocated.

        Start a new hash by initializing state with a seed, using 32_reset.

        Then, feed the hash state by calling 32_update as many times as necessary. Obviously, input must be valid, meaning allocated and read accessible. The function returns an error code, with 0 meaning OK, and any other value meaning there is an error.

        Parameters:
        statePtr - the XXH32State to use
        input - the bytes to hash. The memory between input & input+length must be valid (allocated and read-accessible).
        length - the number of bytes stored at memory address input

      • XXH32_update

        public static int XXH32_update(XXH32State statePtr,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer input)
        Alternative version of: 32_update

      • XXH32_digest

        public static int XXH32_digest(XXH32State statePtr)
        Returns the final 32-bits hash of the specified XXH32State.

        You can nonetheless continue feeding the hash state with more input, and therefore get some new hashes, by calling again 32_digest.

        When you are done, don't forget to free XXH state space, using 32_freeState.

        Parameters:
        statePtr - the XXH32State to use

      • XXH64_reset

        public static int XXH64_reset(XXH64State statePtr,
              long seed)
        64-bit version of 32_reset.
        Parameters:
        statePtr - the XXH64State to reset
        seed - the seed that can be used to alter the hashing result predictably
